title: Schema for POST /invoices
description: Invoice is a business document which can contain attachments.

clientToken.description: Token generated by client (uuid). Used to verify that specific Invoice is only sent and processed once, if response time-outs, retry should be executed with the same clientToken.

refId.description: Unique file identifier received after storing file into Basware Network.

deliveryChannelPreference.description: The way document to be routed, printing-always goes for printing as sender specific processing, only-eInvoicing goes for normal processing as receiver specific processing, printing-allowed goes first for only-eInvoicing if fails then for printing-always, empty value goes by-default for only-eInvoicing case

serviceProviderId.description: Identifier for the intermediate service provider.

data.description: Object holding the business content of the Invoice. Content is at some level based on Universal Business Language (UBL) standard version 2.1. It has also been extended by Basware so it is not strictly UBL.

typeCode.description: The type of document being referenced, expressed as a code, for example to reference to an Invoice document, code is 380.

endpoint.description: An array holding the external system identifiers of the party. Used for defining customer, supplier and delivery party data.

id.description: An object holding the external system identifier of the party.

schemeId.description: External global identifier of the id identifier element.

items.description: An object holding a party identification.

postalAddress.description: An object containing address information. Used for defining supplier party, customer party and delivery party address data.

cityName.description: The name of the city, town or village in the postal address of the party.

postalZone.description: The postal code of the area in the postal address of the party. The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

addressLine.description: The address line of the postal address of the party.

addressLine2.description: The second address line of the postal address of the party.

locality.description: Neighbourhood or district within town or city. Required in UK if a similar road name exists within a post town area.

countrySubentity.description: The sub-entity of the area in the postal address.

countryId.description: The country of the postal address of party. Valid values: ISO3166-1 alpha-2 values can be used.

id.description: An object holding the external system identifier of the party.

schemeId.description: External global identifier of the id identifier element.

items.description: An object holding a party identification.

id.description: An object holding the external system identifier of the party.

schemeId.description: External global identifier of the id identifier element.

cityName.description: The name of the city, town or village in the postal address of the party.

postalZone.description: The postal code of the area in the postal address of the party. The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

addressLine.description: The address line of the postal address of the party.

addressLine2.description: The second address line of the postal address of the party.

locality.description: Neighbourhood or district within town or city. Required in UK if a similar road name exists within a post town area.

countrySubentity.description: The sub-entity of the area in the postal address.

countryId.description: The country of the postal address of party. Valid values: ISO3166-1 alpha-2 values can be used.

partyTaxScheme.description: Information about taxes. Notice that only one tax scheme is used, although there could be multiple.

id.description: A tax identifier for a company. The identifier assigned for tax purposes to a party by the taxation authority.

schemeId.description: External global identifier of the endpoint identifier element. Valid values: Country specific agency schema, example DK:CVR for Denmark.

name.description: A contact name of the party.

telephone.description: A telephone number of the contact of the party.

telefax.description: A fax number of the contact of the party.

electronicMail.description: An email of the contact of the party.

actualDeliveryDate.description: Date when the goods/services are delivered. Valid values must be in format: CCYY-MM-DD. If the time zone is known, it must be represented with +hh:mm or -hh:mm or Z (which means UTC). If time zone is not known, it must be left empty.

deliveryParty.description: Party that is responsible for the delivery of the goods/services in the referred business document.

endpoint.description: An array holding the external system identifiers of the party. Used for defining customer, supplier and delivery party data.

id.description: An object holding the external system identifier of the party.

schemeId.description: External global identifier of the id identifier element.

partyIdentification.description: An array holding the external system identifiers of the party. Used for defining customer, supplier and delivery party data.

items.description: An object holding a party identification.

id.description: An object holding the external system identifier of the party.

schemeId.description: External global identifier of the id identifier element.

partyName.description: A name of the party. Used for defining supplier, customer and delivery party names.

postalAddress.description: An object containing address information. Used for defining supplier party, customer party and delivery party address data.

cityName.description: The name of the city, town or village in the postal address of the party.

postalZone.description: The postal code of the area in the postal address of the party. The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

addressLine.description: The address line of the postal address of the party.

addressLine2.description: The second address line of the postal address of the party.

locality.description: Neighbourhood or district within town or city. Required in UK if a similar road name exists within a post town area.

countrySubentity.description: The sub-entity of the area in the postal address.

countryId.description: The country of the postal address of party. Valid values: ISO3166-1 alpha-2 values can be used.

id.description: A tax identifier for a company. The identifier assigned for tax purposes to a party by the taxation authority.

schemeId.description: External global identifier of the endpoint identifier element. Valid values: Country specific agency schema, example DK:CVR for Denmark.

contact.description: An object containing information about contacts. Used for defining the company contact data

name.description: A contact name of the party.

telephone.description: A telephone number of the contact of the party.

telefax.description: A fax number of the contact of the party.

electronicMail.description: An email of the contact of the party.

paymentMeans.description: An object holding the available payment means.

id.description: The id value of payment identifier.

schemeId.description: Scheme which identifies the type of payment identifier. Possible values are SPY, ISO.

items.description: Object holding the financial account data

virtualBankBarcode.title: VirtualBankBarcode
virtualBankBarcode.description: Virtual bar code can be added to the business document that should be printed.

id.title: Virtual bank bar code
id.description: Identifier of the virtual bar code.

schemeId.title: SchemeId for virtual bank bar code
schemeId.description: Scheme identifier of the virtual bank bar code, typically country code according to ISO3166-1 alpha-2. Possible values: FI

settlementPeriod.description: An object holding the settlement period dates.

startDate.description: Date when the payment terms starts. Valid values must be in format: CCYY-MM-DD. If the time zone is known, it must be represented with +hh:mm or -hh:mm or Z (which means UTC). If time zone is not known, it must be left empty.

endDate.description: Date when the payment terms ends. Valid values must be in format: CCYY-MM-DD. If the time zone is known, it must be represented with +hh:mm or -hh:mm or Z (which means UTC). If time zone is not known, it must be left empty.

note.description: Free-form text applying to the payment terms. This field may contain notes or any other similar information that is not contained explicitly in another structure.

currencyId.description: A code that identifies the currency of the total payable amount. Valid values: ISO 4217 code represented as string.

amount.description: Total amount of the taxes. The total tax amount for particular tax scheme e.g. VAT; the sum of each of the tax subtotals for each tax category within the tax scheme.

items.description: An object holding the information about tax.

currencyId.description: A code that identifies the currency of the tax subtotal. Valid values: ISO 4217 code represented as string.

percent.description: The tax rate for the category, expressed as a percentage.

taxableAmount.description: Basis of the taxes. The net amount to which the tax percent (rate) is applied to calculate the tax amount.

lineExtensionAmount.description: An object holding total amount of line extensions.

currencyId.description: A code that identifies the currency of the total line extension amount. Valid values: ISO 4217 code represented as string.

payableAmount.description: An object holding total payable amount of line extensions.

currencyId.description: A code that identifies the currency of the total payable amount. Valid values: ISO 4217 code represented as string.

amount.description: The total amount to be paid.

items.description: An object holding a Invoice line.
Description of the Business Document line item.

name.description: Name of the Business Document line item.  A short name optionally given to an item, such as a name from a catalogue, as distinct from a description.

id.description: Id of the Business Document line item as it is in sellers system.

schemeId.description: External system specific identifier of the sellers item identifier element. If the source business document has any matching element, it should be used.

items.description: An object holding the information about tax.

amount.description: Amount of tax for the transaction.
The price of the line item.

currencyId.description: A code that identifies the currency of the line item price. Valid values: ISO 4217 code represented as string.

actualDeliveryDate.description: Date when the goods/services are delivered. Valid values must be in format: CCYY-MM-DD. If the time zone is known, it must be represented with +hh:mm or -hh:mm or Z (which means UTC). If time zone is not known, it must be left empty.

lineId.description: An identifier for the referenced order line, assigned by the buyer.

orderReference.description: A reference to the order containing the referenced order line.

chargeIndicator.description: Indicates whether the allowance charge is a charge (true) or a discount (false).

multiplierFactorNumeric.description: The factor applied to the base amount to calculate the allowance charge.
